00049 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00050         // Define local variables in the main
00051         char c = 0;
00052         char *str = NULL;
00053         int on = 0;
00054         int off = 0;
00055         int num = 0;
00056 
00057         if (argc >= 2) {
00058                 if ( strcmp(argv[1], "--help") == 0 
00059                         || strcmp(argv[1], "-h") == 0 ) help_function(argc, argv);
00060 
00061                 else if ( strcmp(argv[1], "--show-warranty") == 0
00062                                 || strcmp(argv[1], "-sw") == 0) {
00063                         showWarranty();
00064                 }
00065 
00066                 else if ( strcmp(argv[1], "--show-license") == 0
00067                                 || strcmp(argv[1], "-sl") == 0) {
00068 
00069                         showLicense();
00070                 }
00071 
00072                 else if ( strcmp(argv[1], "--morse") == 0
00073                                 || strcmp(argv[1], "-m") == 0) {
00074                         printf("What character would you morse (0 to exit): ");
00075                         scanf("%c", &c);
00076                         if (c == '0') return 0;
00077                         blinkMorseChar(c);
00078                         return 0;
00079                 }
00080 
00081                 else if ( strcmp(argv[1], "--morsestring") == 0
00082                                 || strcmp(argv[1], "-ms") == 0) {
00083                         printf("What string would you morse (0 to exit): ");
00084                         fgets(str, 1024, stdin);
00085                         printf("%s", str);
00086                         if (c == '0') return 0;
00087                         blinkMorseString(str);
00088                 }
00089 
00090                 else if ( strcmp(argv[1], "--blink") == 0
00091                                 || strcmp(argv[1], "-b") == 0) {
00092                         printf("Light on: ");
00093                         scanf("%d", &on);
00094                         printf("Light off: ");
00095                         scanf("%d", &off);
00096                         printf("How often the light is on: ");
00097                         scanf("%d", &num);
00098                         blinkLight(on, off, num);
00099                 }
00100 
00101         } else {
00102                 help_function(argc, argv);
00103                 return 0;
00104         }
00105         return -1;
00106 }
00107 
00108 int error_handler(char *fctname, int statnumber) {
00109         if (statnumber >= 0) return statnumber;
00110 
00111         else if (statnumber < 0) {
00112                 printf("Error %d appeared in '%s'.\n", errno, fctname);
00113                 return -1;
00114         }
00115         return -1;
00116 }
00117 
00118 int help_function(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00119         printf("Usage: %s [OPTION] \n", argv[0]);
00120         printf("\nthinkpad toolkit Copyright (C) 2008 Alex Oberhauser\n");
00121         printf("This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type '-sw'.\n");
00122         printf("This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it\n");
00123         printf("under certain conditions; type '-sl' for details\n");
00124         printf("\n");
00125         printf("The program tests the implementation of the thinkpad toolkit, which was\n");
00126         printf("written by Alex Oberhauser. If you would use the hole function you must\n");
00127         printf("have write rights to the file \"%s\"\n", LIGHTPROC);
00128         printf("\nOption: \n");
00129         printf("\t-h,  --help           Display only this help.\n");
00130         printf("\t-b,  --blink          The light blinks in a fix intervall.\n");
00131         printf("\t-m,  --morse          You can morse a character.\n");
00132         printf("\t-sw, --show-warranty  Show the warranty of this program.\n");
00133         printf("\t-sl, --show-license   Show the license of this program.\n");
00134         return -1;
00135 }
